medical_history.chief_complaint: Right hip pain and limited mobility for over a year following a fall.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was admitted to the hospital in December 2009 with complaints of right hip pain and limited mobility that began over a year prior to admission after a fall. The pain limited movement but was slightly relieved with rest, allowing her to walk.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a 10-year history of multiple untreated skeletal abnormalities and was diagnosed with a facial bone deformity at the age of 14. She had normal menstruation and secondary sexual characteristics, and delivered a child naturally at the age of 24. She received 5 mg of zoledronic acid intravenously four times between 2009 and 2013 and underwent a total hip replacement in July 2010, followed by a right supracondylar osteotomy in December 2013, and internal fixation of a left femoral shaft fracture in May 2015.
